title: Free Weather
description: My lastest endevor. This is a simple weather app that I have released on both the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store. I am working on updates, adding new features every few weeks. This was built using HTML, CSS and JavaScipt with Apache Cordova/PhoneGap.

title: Check In App
description: This is my biggest project by far. Allows admin to sign up, create users and set required intervals for check ins. Users can check in and admin will be notified when they are late. Code, more info and credentials on GitHub.

title: Personal Page
description: My personal page. Updated October 2016 from my original. Mobile friendly and reponsive using plain HTML, CSS and JavaScript. PHP is also used for the Contact Form.

title: HighCharts Example
description: Example site I created to get some more experience with the HighCharts library and API's. This project uses JavaScript, Bootstrap, jQuery and the HighCharts library. Also uses the quandl API.

title: Dynamic Modal
description: Example site of a single modal populated with data from a JSON file using a get request. This project uses JavaScript, Bootstrap and jQuery.

title: Torrent Notifier
description: Cross platform desktop application created with electron.js. Allows adding of favourite shows to track on a calendar and notify when available as a torrent. Automatic opening of torrent client is also supported. Follow the link below to see more screenshots and code.

title: Cloud Journal
description: Very simple site that lets you save what you type into a text field. One of my first three projects in PHP, JavaScript and jQuery.

title: Weather Forecaster
description: Enter a city and it will return a short summary of weather conditions for that city. This project uses PHP, JavaScript and jQuery.

title: Postal Code Lookup
description: Allows you to look up the postal code for a given address. Also shows given address location on a Google Map. This project uses PHP, JavaScript, jQuery and a few Google Maps API's.

title: Arduino - Sun Sensor
description: I really enjoy working with microcontrollers and electronics as well. This was my very first project using Arduino that I completed myself. Link to code and wiring diagram is available if you follow the youTube link below.

title: Temperature Recorder
description: I set this up as my first foray into the HighCharts library. It uses a script running on Microsoft Azure to get temperature data from two sources and stores it in a Google Spreadsheet. Uses JavaScript, HighCharts Library, and OpenWeather API.
